issues.description: The problem statement (Part 2) says "Each method takes a `Consumer<List<Note>>` parameter... This consumer takes the internal list of persons as a parameter" which mixes 'Note' and 'Person' in the parameter type. The client template and the intended design expect PersonController methods to take Consumer<List<Person>>. This textual/type mismatch in the problem statement can confuse students about the correct parameter type to implement for PersonController methods.
issues.suggested_fix: In the problem statement, replace the incorrect reference to Consumer<List<Note>> with Consumer<List<Person>> so the description matches the template and intended implementation. For example: "Each method takes a Consumer<List<Person>> parameter, which has to be called after a response is received â€” this consumer takes the internal list of persons as a parameter."
